title: Perilous Times and Scripture
shortSummary: In 2 Timothy 3, Paul warns Timothy about the difficult and dangerous times that will characterize the last days, marked by moral decay and false teachers. He encourages steadfastness in the truth of Scripture, emphasizing its divine inspiration and practical use for equipping believers for godly living.
timeline: c. AD 67 - Paul's Second Roman Imprisonment

keyCharacters.name: Paul
keyCharacters.description: The apostle writing this letter to Timothy, warning him about future challenges and encouraging faithfulness to sound doctrine.

keyCharacters.name: Timothy
keyCharacters.description: Paul’s young protégé and pastor, receiving instruction and encouragement to remain steadfast in the gospel.

keyCharacters.name: Jannes and Jambres
keyCharacters.description: Traditional names given to the magicians who opposed Moses, used here as examples of those resisting the truth.

definitions.definition: Dangerous and difficult periods characterized by moral and spiritual decline, especially in the last days.
An outward appearance or pretense of being religious without the true power or heart change that accompanies genuine faith.
The divine influence by which the Holy Spirit guided the human authors to write Scripture without error in the original manuscripts.
Morally rejected or corrupt, especially in reference to those who have rejected the faith and resist the truth.

outline.heading: Warning of Perilous Times
outline.description: Paul describes the moral and spiritual decay that will characterize the last days, listing specific sinful behaviors and warning against those who have only an outward form of godliness but deny its power.

outline.heading: Deceptive Teachers and Their Influence
outline.description: Paul warns about false teachers who exploit vulnerable people, resist the truth like Jannes and Jambres, and whose folly will ultimately be exposed.

outline.heading: Paul’s Example and Encouragement
outline.description: Paul reminds Timothy of his own godly example and the persecutions he endured, encouraging Timothy to expect similar trials and to remain faithful.

outline.heading: The Importance of Scripture
outline.description: Paul exhorts Timothy to continue in the teachings he has learned, emphasizing that all Scripture is God-breathed and useful for teaching, correction, and equipping believers for every good work.

application: Remain vigilant against the moral and spiritual dangers of the last days by grounding your life in Scripture and godly character.
Avoid those who have only a form of godliness but deny its power; instead, seek genuine faith and transformation through Christ.
Follow the example of faithful servants like Paul by enduring persecution and trials with patience and trust in God's deliverance.
Commit daily to studying and applying Scripture, recognizing it as the inspired and sufficient guide for righteous living and ministry.

keyVerses.text: This know also, that in the last days perilous times shall come.
keyVerses.significance: Sets the tone for the chapter by alerting believers to the challenging moral climate of the last days.

keyVerses.text: Having a form of godliness, but denying the power thereof: from such turn away.
keyVerses.significance: Warns believers to reject superficial religion that lacks true spiritual power.

keyVerses.text: All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:
keyVerses.significance: Affirms the divine origin and practical purpose of Scripture for equipping believers.

keyVerses.text: That the man of God may be perfect, throughly furnished unto all good works.
keyVerses.significance: Highlights the goal of Scripture’s work: to fully equip believers for godly living and service.
